BBEX3.M.GYD.USD.CA.AC.A01: Exchange rates for the US dollar in Guyana / USD 1 = GYD ... (middle)

General: In addition to the official exchange rate, which only applied to sugar trading, revenue from bauxite exports, payments for fuel imports, as well as servicing the public sector`s external debt, there was a free market rate (known as the cambio market rate); however, we did not have any data on these rates. On 30 September 1991, the official exchange rate and the cambio market rate were harmonised.
Source: Calculated on the basis of the buying and selling rates of the Bank of Guyana, Georgetown.

Comment on 1991-02: On 21 February 1991, the Guyana dollar was devalued. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate).  20.02.91: 1 USD = 44.97188 / 45.19688 GYD  21.02.91: 1 USD = 101.68641 / 102.19516 GYD.  Calculated devaluation: 55.8% (middle rate).
